verses.kjv: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.
verses.ct: Give thanks to the LORD! Call out his name! Let the nations know what he has done.

verses.kjv: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.
verses.ct: Sing to him, make music to him — tell everyone about all his amazing works.

verses.kjv: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
verses.ct: Take pride in his holy name; let the hearts of those who pursue the LORD be filled with joy.

verses.kjv: Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.
verses.ct: Turn to the LORD and his strength; seek his presence continually.

verses.kjv: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
verses.ct: Remember the incredible things he has done — his miracles and the rulings he has spoken.

verses.kjv: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.
verses.ct: You descendants of Abraham his servant, you children of Jacob, his chosen ones —

verses.kjv: He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.ct: he is the LORD our God; his rulings extend across the whole earth.

verses.kjv: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.
verses.ct: He has kept his covenant forever, the promise he established for 1,000 generations.

verses.kjv: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;
verses.ct: This is the covenant he made with Abraham, and the oath he swore to Isaac.

verses.kjv: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
verses.ct: He confirmed it to Jacob as a binding decree, and to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

verses.kjv: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:
verses.ct: saying, "I will give you the land of Canaan as your allotted inheritance."

verses.kjv: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
verses.ct: At that time they were just a small group of people — very few — and they were foreigners in that land.

verses.kjv: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;
verses.ct: They wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.

verses.kjv: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;
verses.ct: He didn't let anyone mistreat them; he even rebuked kings on their behalf,

verses.kjv: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
verses.ct: saying, "Don't touch my anointed ones, and don't harm my prophets."

verses.kjv: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.
verses.ct: Then he summoned a famine on the land and cut off every supply of food.

verses.kjv: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:
verses.ct: He had sent a man ahead of them — Joseph, who was sold as a slave.

verses.kjv: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:
verses.ct: They clamped his feet in shackles; iron chains were put around his neck.

verses.kjv: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.
verses.ct: This lasted until his prediction came true; the word of the LORD tested and refined him.

verses.kjv: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.
verses.ct: The king gave the order to release him; the ruler of the people set him free.

verses.kjv: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:
verses.ct: He put him in charge of his entire household and made him manager of everything he owned,

verses.kjv: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.
verses.ct: with authority to direct his officials as he saw fit and to teach his advisors wisdom.

verses.kjv: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
verses.ct: Then Israel came to Egypt; Jacob settled in the land of Ham.

verses.kjv: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.
verses.ct: God caused his people to multiply rapidly and made them more powerful than their enemies.

verses.kjv: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
verses.ct: He turned the Egyptians' hearts to despise his people and to scheme against his servants.

verses.kjv: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.
verses.ct: He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron, the one he had chosen.

verses.kjv: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
verses.ct: They performed his miraculous signs among the Egyptians — wonders throughout the land of Ham.

verses.kjv: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
verses.ct: He sent darkness and made the land black, and they did not defy his word.

verses.kjv: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.
verses.ct: He turned their waters into blood and killed their fish.

verses.kjv: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.
verses.ct: Their land swarmed with frogs, even invading the rooms of their kings.

verses.kjv: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.
verses.ct: He spoke, and swarms of flies appeared, along with gnats throughout their entire territory.

verses.kjv: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
verses.ct: He replaced their rain with hail and sent bolts of lightning across their land.

verses.kjv: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.
verses.ct: He struck down their grapevines and fig trees and shattered the trees throughout their territory.

verses.kjv: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,
verses.ct: He spoke, and locusts came — young locusts beyond counting —

verses.kjv: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
verses.ct: and they consumed every plant in the land and devoured all the crops from their soil.

verses.kjv: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
verses.ct: Then he struck down every firstborn in their land, the first display of all their strength.

verses.kjv: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.
verses.ct: He brought his people out carrying silver and gold, and not a single person among their tribes stumbled.

verses.kjv: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.
verses.ct: Egypt was relieved when they left, because dread of Israel had overwhelmed them.

verses.kjv: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.
verses.ct: He spread out a cloud as a shelter over them and provided fire to light up the night.

verses.kjv: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
verses.ct: The people asked, and he brought quail; he satisfied them with bread from heaven.

verses.kjv: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.
verses.ct: He split open the rock, and water poured out — it flowed like a river through the desert.

verses.kjv: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.
verses.ct: He did this because he remembered his sacred promise to Abraham his servant.

verses.kjv: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:
verses.ct: He led his people out with joy, his chosen ones with shouts of celebration.

verses.kjv: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;
verses.ct: He gave them the lands of other nations, and they took possession of what those peoples had worked for,

verses.kjv: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.
verses.ct: so that they would follow his commands and obey his instructions. Praise the LORD!
